result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Todd Stair was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered all costs, fees, assessments and DNA surcharge due and owing by 04-04-2017 or 10 days in jail.
Defendant to provide DNA sample.
Court orders zero days drivers license revocation.
With credit for 3 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

ADDRESS INFO for Travis Todd Stair
Current: 2137B S. Woodward Street, Milwaukee, WI 53207 United States  (Effective: 04-07-2016)
Prior: 500 so. edwards blvd #6, lake geneva, WI 53147 United States

Defendant Travis Todd Stair in court with attorney William Marquis.  Katie Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, plea agreement and Addendum to Plea received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to 3 days in the House of Corrections,  with 3 days credit for a time served disposition.
Defendant to provide DNA sample.
Court ordered all costs, fees, assessments and DNA surcharges due and owing by 4/4/2017 or 10 days in jail. 
Court orders zero days drivers license revocation.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Travis Todd Stair in court with attorney William O. Marquis.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Branch 47 in jury trial.    Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 47 on day of jury trial.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
to Court of Need to Conduct Hearing, received and filed

Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Travis Todd Stair in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Travis Todd Stair in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47 Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.
